alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Campbell; Marion; Morgan; Scott; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 16 at 6:04AM CST until January 17 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST /11 AM CST/ TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM EST /4 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON EST /11 AM CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Chill Advisory this morning, very cold wind chills as low as 10 below zero. For the second Wind Chill Advisory tonight through Wednesday morning, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Cumberland Plateau and Cumberland Mountains of East Tennessee. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory this morning, until noon EST /11 AM CST/ today. For the second Wind Chill Advisory tonight through Wednesday morning, from 5 PM EST /4 PM CST/ this afternoon to noon EST /11 AM CST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Even after snow and freezing drizzle have ended, icy hazardous travel is expected today and tonight, especially on untreated roads.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Bledsoe; Campbell; Marion; Morgan; Scott; Sequatchie
